definition[0]: if a liquid or something wet freezes or is frozen, it becomes hard and solid because the temperature is very cold
definition[1]: to preserve food for a long time by keeping it at a very low temperature, or to be preserved in this way
example[1]: I think I’ll freeze that extra meat.
definition[2]: if a machine, engine, pipe etc freezes, the liquid inside it becomes solid with cold, so that it does not work properly
example[4]: I nearly froze to death watching that football match.
definition[4]: if a government or company freezes wages, prices etc, they do not increase them for a period of time
example[5]: The government has been forced to cut spending and freeze public-sector wages.
definition[5]: to legally prevent money in a bank from being spent, property from being sold etc
definition[6]: to stop moving suddenly and stay completely still and quiet
example[7]: I froze and listened; someone was in my apartment.
definition[7]: to stop a DVD or video in order to be able to look at a particular part of it
example[9]: He froze the picture on the screen.
definition[8]: a time when people are not allowed to increase prices or pay
definition[9]: the stopping of some activity or process
example[11]: The government have imposed a freeze on civil service appointments.
definition[10]: a period of extremely cold weather
definition[11]: a short period of time, especially at night, when the temperature is extremely low
definition[12]: if a government or company freezes prices, wages etc, they keep them at a particular level
example[12]: The company cut executive salaries by 10%, all remaining salaries were frozen.
example[13]: The president froze fuel prices and set a ceiling on prices for basic foodstuffs.
definition[13]: to legally prevent money in a bank from being taken out, property from being sold etc, for example because there is a disagreement concerning it
example[14]: A federal judge froze more than $20 million in FundAmerica bank accounts last Friday after several California investors sued Mr Edwards.
definition[14]: to stop an activity or a proposed activity for a period of time
example[15]: The airline froze hiring and instructed employees to reduce spending.
example[16]: Mr Smith has frozen plans to develop the record company.
definition[15]: if a computer or a computer screen freezes, the image on the screen will not change because of a problem with the computer
example[17]: My computer froze and I had to reboot it.
definition[16]: when prices, wages etc are fixed at a particular level
example[18]: They said the cable television industry was abusing its market position, and called for a mandatory price freeze in cable rates.
example[19]: The prime minister called for a pay freeze to help keep inflation down.
definition[17]: when an activity is stopped for a period of time
example[20]: If the government imposes a freeze on the roads programme, up to 20,000 jobs could be lost.
example[21]: In an effort to reduce overheads, they laid off a quarter of the staff and initiated a hiring freeze (=when a company does not take new employees).
